thread.title: The Velvet Underground Founder Loves Chance the Rapper, Earl Sweatshirt, Vince Staples & More
thread.title_full: The Velvet Underground Founder Loves Chance the Rapper, Earl Sweatshirt, Vince Staples & More

author: Hypebeast (info@hypebeast.com)
title: The Velvet Underground Founder Loves Chance the Rapper, Earl Sweatshirt, Vince Staples & More
text:
Speaking with Savages' Jehnny Beth on her Beats 1 show Start Making Sense , the Velvet Underground founder John Cale revealed that he is working on a new album -- and it's heavily inspired by modern rap music. He discloses that he's been "listening to all this hip-hop," including music by Chance the Rapper, Donnie Trumpet, Earl Sweatshirt, Vince Staples, Mike WiLL Made-It, Domo Genesis and others. Cale says that his forthcoming album is set to arrive this spring. Listen to the conversation below.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast.com
